intro: Ardisia samalana, commonly known as the Philippine ardisia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Following flowering, it develops bright red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Ardisia samalana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
